intro: Corycium deflexum, commonly known as the flexed corycium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Orchidaceae. It is native to certain regions of South America, particularly in Brazil. The plant is characterized by its unique, pendulous inflorescence and distinctive floral morphology. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange in color, with intricate patterns that aid in pollination by specific insects. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Corycium deflexum is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
